text.0: with what bright beauty are the maruts jointly invested peers in age who dwell together.
text.1: from what place have they come with what intention sing they their strength through love of wealth these heroes.
text.2: whose prayers have they the youthful ones accepted who to his sacrifice hath turned the maruts.
text.3: we will delay them on their journey sweepingwith what high spiritthrough the air like eagles.
text.4: whence comest thou alone thou who art mighty indra lord of the brave what is thy purpose.
text.5: thou greetest us when meeting us the bright ones lord of bay steeds say what thou hast against us.
text.6: mine are devotions hymns sweet are libations strength stirs and hurled forth is my bolt of thunder.
text.7: they call for me their lauds are longing for me these my bay steeds bear me to these oblations.
text.8: therefore together with our strong companions having adorned our bodies now we harness.
text.9: our spotted deer with might for thou o indra hast learnt and understood our godlike nature.
text.10: where was that nature then of yours o maruts that ye charged me alone to slay the dragon.
text.11: for i in truth am fierce and strong and mighty i bent away from every foemans weapons.
text.12: yea much hast thou achieved with us for comrades with manly valour like thine own thou hero.
text.13: much may we too achieve o mightiest indra with our great power we maruts when we will it.
text.14: vṛtra i slew by mine own strength o maruts having waxed mighty in mine indignation.
text.15: i with the thunder in my hand created for man these lucid softly flowing waters.
text.16: nothing o maghavan stands firm before thee among the gods not one is found thine equal.
text.17: none born or springing into life comes nigh thee do what thou hast to do exceeding mighty.
text.18: mine only be transcendent power whatever i daring in my spirit may accomplish.
text.19: for i am known as terrible o maruts i indra am the lord of what i ruined.
text.20: now o ye maruts hath your praise rejoiced me the glorious hymn which ye have made me heroes.
text.21: for me for indra champion strong in battle for me yourselves as lovers for a lover.
text.22: here truly they send forth their sheen to meet me wearing their blameless glory and their vigour.
text.23: when i have seen you maruts in gay splendour ye have delighted me so now delight me.
text.24: who here hath magnified you o ye maruts speed forward o ye lovers to your lovers.
text.25: ye radiant ones assisting their devotions of these my holy rites he ye regardful.
text.26: to this hath mānyas wisdom brought us so as to aid as aids the poet him who worships.
text.27: bring hither quick on to the sage ye maruts these prayers for you the singer hath recited.
text.28: may this your praise may this your song o maruts sung by the poet mānas son māndārya.
text.29: bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
